result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis J Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.08(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Vocational training.
Obtain/maintain full time employment, be enrolled in an educational program full time, or a combination of both.
No contact with firearms, ammunition or body armor.

Court set restitution at ZERO.
Per the Court, all costs, fees, and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) are WAIVED due to the defendant's inability to pay.
Provide any prescriptions to agent before filling the prescriptions.
Mental health evaluation.
Provide DNA sample.

Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs.
AODA evaluation and comply with recommended treatment
Random urine screens.

charges.descr: Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dennis J Jackson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (43 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing MAY 1, 2015 received and filed.
Victim Impact Statement received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
PSI received via email from the Department of Corrections and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

Defendant Dennis J Jackson in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Dennis J Jackson in custody.  Paul Tiffin appeared for Antoni J. Apollo for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. Defendant sworn.

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.
Court ordered a presentence investigation WITHOUT a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 
Case adjourned to branch 25.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Proposed verdict forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions with attached substantive instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Arguments heard as to bail. Court denied defense motion. Bail remains the same.

Defendant Dennis J Jackson in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Dennis J Jackson in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for arraignment.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests a projected plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Dennis J Jackson in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Dennis J Jackson in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State files an AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT, charges and penalities remain the same.
Sworn for the state:Nicholas Johnson-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Arraignment scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dennis J Jackson in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Dennis J Jackson in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
